The humor in the image arises from the juxtaposition of two contrasting scenes, highlighted by the "Yes, but" text. On the left, a romantic and idealized scene is depicted: a couple enjoying an elegant breakfast in bed, symbolized by a heart between them. This conveys a sense of intimacy and love.

On the right, the stark contrast is shown with a view of the same bed now messy and stained. This illustrates the often overlooked, less glamorous aftermath of an activity that seems perfect in theory. The satirical element lies in pointing out the gap between romantic expectations and the messy reality, playing on the comedic effect of unexpected realism interrupting idealized moments.
